posts.name: Smita Dhadhal
posts.cooked:
Hi @carlton ,

Can you pls share how the score for project 1 has been calculated? If we consider the 80:20 ratio for submission and peer grading, the marks displayed on the dashboard is different. Also there was a mention of 1 bonus mark for every peer review which is not an outlier . Will we get it ?

posts.name: Anupam Chandra
posts.cooked: One bonus mark from the 100 marks assigned for the peer review, i.e., if peer reviews have 4 marks overall, you get 1% of those 4 marks, which would be 4/100 = 0.04 marks.

posts.name: Smita Dhadhal
posts.cooked: Oh ok … …in that case it is of no use …

posts.name: Smita Dhadhal
posts.cooked: Do u know how did they calculate the project 1 score ?

posts.name: Anupam Chandra
posts.cooked:
From the course introduction page:

image893×433 23 KB

Apart from this, I believe each question in Project 1 had an equal number of marks. For e.g., if you have 10 questions and a total of 16 marks (4 additional for peer reviews), then each correct answer should get you 1.6 marks.

Multiply the project answer marks by 5 to get your total out of 100. If you want to add peer review marks to it, multiply the marks from the answers by 4 and divide the marks from the peer reviews by 5 and add both of them to get your total marks from Project 1 out of 100.

posts.name: Smita Dhadhal
posts.cooked:
I have just simply taken the approach as
(Marks in submission ×0.8) + (Marks in peer review part ×0.2 )
Can this work as basically we have to take 80:20 ratio .
This way we simply get our marks for project 1 out of 100.
We can take 20 percent of it to calculate the marks we get in the final score .

posts.name: Anupam Chandra
posts.cooked: Yes this is exactly how the total is calculated.

posts.name: Smita Dhadhal
posts.cooked: Yes , but if we calculate this way …the marks shown on dashboard is different for project 1. Maybe @carlton will explain how it is being calculated?

posts.name: Anupam Chandra
posts.cooked: What are your marks on the dashboard and what is your breakup?

posts.name: Smita Dhadhal
posts.cooked:
For submission part I have got 100 and for peer review part I have got 91.
100×0.8 = 80
91 ×0.2 =18.2
The total should come as 98.2 , instead it is showing 94.

posts.name: Anupam Chandra
posts.cooked: Your calculations are correct. I tried them on my scores and my numbers are matching, so there seems to be some error in your scores. You have already marked Carlton on the post, so hopefully he will respond with a resolution.

posts.name: Aarush Agarwal
posts.cooked:
Facing same doubt here as well, seems like outlier wasn’t removed in my case
Got 40, 95 and 100 in peer reviews and peer grading marks as 89.
Calculation is a bit confusing either ways regardless of outlier removal or not
Would appreciate a clarification regarding the same @carlton

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
@23f1001749 @iitmanupam @22f3001115

I have been informed this morning, that all updated (& rescored) marks, marked responses, review scores will be pushed by tomorrow to portal.

Kind regards
